hook.text: Your house is an asset, right? Robert Kiyosaki says: if it costs you money every month, it's a liability.

buildup.text: An asset puts money in your pocket. A liability takes money out. The distinction drives financial health.

discovery.text: A rental property generating income is an asset. A personal home costing mortgage, taxes, and repairs is a liability.

twist.text: Cars, boats, and luxury items feel like assets but almost always depreciate and drain cash â€” classic liabilities.

climax.text: The wealthy focus on acquiring assets first. The middle class buys liabilities they think are assets.

punchline.text: Buy assets first. Then let assets buy your luxuries.

quiz.question: According to Kiyosaki, what makes something an asset?
options: It puts money in your pocket
It has a high purchase price
